lessonPages.text: In Go there is a rule called ko, which stipulates that moves can't recreate immediately previous board states. This rule prevents games from going on forever and prevents scoring issues, since the number of enemy pieces captured factors into many scoring systems.
The above example shows ko in action. Black can't play E6 because it would recreate the immediately previous board state.
Moves are also illegal if they will be immediately captured. This is referred to as suicide.
